title: Who are the present day descendants of Atilla the Hun? - Quora

response.answer_text: A2A, John Kawakami. Considering that Attila the Hun was a prominent statesman and organiser who transformed Central European peoples, in particular the German tribes into structures that defined German national characteristics and state structures after that, with influence much more than Herman,a Hun, Hunlu, Hunnu, Hyung-nu, Western Hun, but considering the dark yellow flag, also a Central Hun, named the Atil-born, or Volga-born, of the Western Turkish Ogur tribes, speaking r Turkish as opposed to z Turkish, continued by Bulgars, Khazars and modern Chuvash people of the Volga region,an emperor of several tribes, some usual Eurasian horse peoples, such as Turkic, Mongolic, Ugric, Finnic, Tungusic, Sogd, as well as some newly transformed ones such as Germanic, Slavic and Baltic,his descendants are: ethnically the Chuvash, who retained some Hunnic and Bulgaric characteristics as well as the language which used to be much more prominent throughout Eurasia than Standard Turkish (all other Turkish languages today),  The Chuvash in folkloric dress culturally all Eurasian peoples, including Turks, Mongols and Hungarians. who had not migrated to central Europe in larger numbers from Volga area then.  Hungarian Kurultay, commemorating Attila and Eurasian Turanic brotherhood administratively the Germans, starting with Schwabians but including Goths who had included Balts and Slavs, extending to all Germanic peoples living today, which were transformed from scattered feuding forest dwellers to sophisticated Eurasian-style soldier-nations,  “Danke, Ettel!” and politically in a general sense all Europeans, who followed the much more favourable decentralised governing structure which led to feudality, crusades and Germanic/Gothic kingdoms and empires, and defined modern Europe as opposed to extremely centralised declining Roman imperial system which did not lead to competition and simultaneous development.  “This is why we are scattered in several competing equal ethnicities unlike the Chinese at the opposite side of Eurasia”

Through his daughter (name not known) and king Ardaric, he is the ancestor of Charlemagne and thus all Europeans. Bernshtam claims the western huns came in the second century to the Hephthalite realm. Due to the Hephthalite's inclination towards intermarriage of other dynastic houses of other huns and non-huns and the royal houses of those huns who are descended from Ernak, son of Attila, intermarriage between the European Hunnic and Hephthalite royalty must have happened. Descendants of Hephthalites include Fatimids, Armenian elites (post Sassanids) and suleymanids (through the Sassanids). The Gujjars, Rajputs, Rashtrkutas, Karluks, Khalachs, Durrani, Bulgars, Khazars, Khazak nobility, Khilji dynasty, and all intermarriage for all these groups.
